N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 8 ยง 86.3 - Processing and approval of applications

State Regulations

Applications for grant awards received by the department
from eligible teachers shall be evaluated and processed by the department in
the following manner: (a) An eligible
teacher who submits a properly completed application to the department during
the application period and a properly completed application for national board
certification to the National Board for Professional Teaching Standards, may be
eligible to receive a grant award pursuant to Education Law, section 3004-a and
this Part, to the extent that funds are available, in the order in which the
application is received by the department. (b) An eligible teacher may apply to receive
grant award funds to cover costs associated with the following types of
applications: (1)
an initial application to
the National Board for Professional Teaching Standards for national board
certification; (2)
a one-time
retake of the application process to obtain national board certification; or
(3)
to pursue a Maintenance of

Certification. (c) In
the event there is insufficient funding to cover all eligible applicants, the
order of priority for administering funds will be as follows: (1)
first time applicants; (2)
applicants who retake one or more
components for the first time; and
(3)
applicants who pursue Maintenance of

Certification. Notes
